  11. I tried the Schick Hydro Silk Disposable Razors for the first time courtesy of BzzAgent, and there are some pros and cons to this type of razor. Pros: I got a very close shave, and the grip and feel of the razor was comfortable. I liked the size of the razor blade head - not too big, and not too small. Now the cons: My legs did not feel moisturized afterwards, and actually felt like the razor had scraped them (hence the close shave I guess!). In the past I have used Schick Hydro Silk Razors (not disposable) and I did not have this problem with them (although the razor head is bigger and I didn't get as close of a shave). So it's a tradeoff. I may purchase them in the future.
  12. I have been using the replaceable version of these razors for about a year now. So when I was given a pack from Schick to try and see how it stands up to the replaceable heads.<br /><br />There were a few difference that I could tell about the disposables. One was the overall quality. The handles were lighter and didn't have a great grip on them but they were good and does the job. The second difdifference was the longevity of the razor head. I can usually get 3 complete shaves from head to toe out of the replaceable heads. However I am getting about half that with the disposables which is to be expected.<br /><br />Overall the 5 blades make a great difference in the way the razors shave and I could take or leave the &#34;moisturizing strip&#34;. It was less mosturizing and more extra gliding power.<br /><br />You won't be disappointed in these razors as they are excellent for the money ( I have since purchased 2 more packs since receiving the first pack free). And work well when spending the extra money on replacement blades just aren't an option.

They really do leave your skin silky and smooth. I have extremely sensitive skin and am allergic to just about everything. I have no issues using this razor as I have with many others. I do not break out, turn red, or end up itching as I do with other brands. I was able to secure a mail freebie for my mom as well and she completely agrees that this has to be the best razor ever made. In fact, I'm on here finding her replacement blades right now because she said that she would like some for Christmas. I find that the razors and replacement blades are a great price. Sometimes I buy the disposable razors of this brand because you get 3 disposable razors for the same price as the original razor that needs replacement blades. The disposable razors last just as long as the replacement blades so you may get a better value by purchasing these disposable razors. 4 blade refills for about $15 vs 3 disposable razors for about $8-both last equally as long, it's all about preference but you do the math.

  140. I received a free sample of this product through BzzAgent but got no other compensation for this review:<br /><br />I have tried the Schick Hydro Silk (non disposable) and I liked it, I just can't get on board with the cartridges. It is so comfortable and makes it so easy to hold in the shower, especially with wet, shaving cream covered hands. It also stays sharp longer than other disposables I've tried. I can easily use the same razor for a week before noticing a difference. The moisturizing bar around the blades is really nice too. It's super convenient for shaving under my arms when I don't always want to use shaving cream and doesn't irritate my skin. My only complaint with this razor is it is difficult to get a good shave with shaving cream the first time you go to use it. I think the moisturizing bar and the shaving cream conflict and the razor just glides right over the shaving cream without getting any of the hair. Luckily, the moisture bar makes it so you don't even need shaving cream the first time you use it. I can shave my legs once and under my arms 2 or 3 times before the moisture bar loses some of its magic, then I can use shaving cream no problem. So I guess it's not so much of a complaint as it is an FYI, you don't need to waste your time with shaving cream with a this razor right away. Ooo imagine going on vacation with this razor and not needing to bring a can of shaving cream! I just thought of that, awesome! I do highly recommend this product.

  187. I really like these razors and will definitely be buying again. I have always been a fan of the Schick brand and when I got to try these for free from Bzzagent, I already knew I was going to like them. They arrived a few days before our trip to Florida and I tossed them in my bag as the razors I was going to bring on our trip with us. I was pretty confident they were going to work well seeing they were all I had brought with me. When I used them for the first time, I lathered my legs up and went to town. They were sharp and did a pretty good job. They have 5 blades which gives you a pretty close shave but they also have a moisturizing strip which in my case, kind of screwed up that close shave. The strip provides kind of a slimy path underneath the head of the razor that mixed with my soap that I had already been using. This seemed to make a barrier that wouldn't allow me to shave anything but slime. After a few passes with the razor, the slime barrier had been broken and it was smooth sailing from there. Pun intended. This only happened the first couple of times I used it and as the moisturizing strip began to fade, the shave became a little easier and required less passes by the razor. I am assuming you could just wet your legs and use the strip as your soap for a smooth shave but I am in the habit of using soap so I didn't do that. The head of the razor bends pretty far back, which allows to you get all those hard to reach places like the back of your knees and your achilles on the back of your foot. I have to say that this little guy seemed to get all those stray strips of hair I always seem to miss and then notice at the most inopportune times. These are also really nice because the blades stay sharp for a lot longer than I would expect them to, which gives your razor an extended life and puts a few more dollars in your pocket that would be used to buy new razors.

  217. I received Schick Hydro Silk disposable razors for free from BzzAgent and was curious to try them as compared to my usual Gillette Venus & Olay razor (the one that doesn't need shave gel/cream). I was grateful for the full-sized can of Skintimate Shave Gel, which I've always thought was a great product, and the next morning, in the shower, I went to work trying it all out.<br /><br />My legs went fine; no surprising issues, nothing special, just shavin' my legs. My underarms were a little tougher. I found that the head didn't quite pivot well enough to get in there without my doing some weird contortionist tricks (e.g., holding the skin of my right underarm taut with my left hand while using my right hand to shave my right underarm - a little tricky!). I don't have this problem with Gillette Venus & Olay razor. Unfortunately for me, multiple passes with a razor usually means irritation. Thankfully I haven't had any irritation, which normally happens to me quite easily, but I imagine with extended use it might become an issue. I can't really say either way.<br /><br />After getting out of the shower and drying off, the skin on my legs was fine. Not luxuriously moisturized, but not dry or irritated, which is a plus. My guess is that due to the awesome shave gel (seriously, I love Skintimate!) as compared to the Venus & Olay, which does not require shave gel/cream, I have an extra layer of protection and moisture. There's definitely something to be said for shave gel/cream as far as its moisturizing/protective abilities and its helping me not to miss spots :)<br /><br />Unless I plan to show a lot of skin (e.g., going to the beach), I generally only shave every other day to save my skin from dryness and irritation. So just one day after using the Schick Hydro Silk disposable razor for the first time, I was sitting in a meeting, wearing a dress with my legs crossed, and I took a glance at my legs. I saw stubble! I couldn't believe it. Thankfully I'm the boss, and my co-workers are like family (it helps that I'm married to one of them), so I wasn't embarrassed, but in almost any other situation I would have been, had someone noticed. It looked like I hadn't shaved in a couple of days. I went to the bathroom and checked my underarms to find the same result. I definitely don't have this issue with Gillette Venus & Olay, so I know I don't just have an unusually high rate of hair growth.<br /><br />I continued using the Schick Hydro Silk disposable razor in hopes that maybe I just did a bad shaving job the first time, but the results kept coming out the same. The next day, it looked like I hadn't shaved in 2-3 days, and even the night of shaving my legs, they were no longer smooth.<br /><br />In an attempt to eliminate any variables, I tried using a brand new Schick Hydro Silk disposable razor and Skintimate Shave Gel and shaving my legs while sitting across the bathtub as opposed to in a running shower. No more smoothness by that night, and visible stubble the next day.<br /><br />The moral of the story: the shave is not close enough somehow. If I want to keep using the Schick Hydro Silk disposable razor, I'll have to shave every day. This girl doesn't have time for that.workers are like family (it helps that I'm married to one of them), so I wasn't embarrassed, but in almost any other situation I would have been, had someone noticed. It looked like I hadn't shaved in a couple of days. I went to the bathroom and checked my underarms to find the same result. I definitely don't have this issue with Gillette Venus & Olay, so I know I don't just have an unusually high rate of hair growth.<br /><br />I continued using the Schick Hydro Silk disposable razor in hopes that maybe I just did a bad shaving job the first time, but the results kept coming out the same. The next day, it looked like I hadn't shaved in 2-3 days, and even the night of shaving my legs, they were no longer smooth.<br /><br />In an attempt to eliminate any variables, I tried using a brand new Schick Hydro Silk disposable razor and Skintimate Shave Gel and shaving my legs while sitting across the bathtub as opposed to in a running shower. No more smoothness by that night, and visible stubble the next day.<br /><br />The moral of the story: the shave is not close enough somehow. If I want to keep using the Schick Hydro Silk disposable razor, I'll have to shave every day. This girl doesn't have time for that.

  231. Schick Hydro Silk® Disposable Razors left something to be desired. When I first received the razors, I was extremely excited to try them. They look so sleek and the packaging made me want to try them. The design of the handle made it super easy to grip. The first time I used the razor I felt like the 5 blades were wonderful and shaved very close. The hair did not grow back near as fast because it was so short. With this I probably could easy go every other day shaving. It really eased around those hard to get areas. I felt like my legs were very smooth and soft the first time around. I really liked the protective layer to keep from having razor burn and to keep my skin moisturized. I was pretty excited with the results. Then the second time I used the razor I took the cover off of the razor and it was stuck on because the protective layer made it stick to the case. When I finally got it off it took most of the protective layer with it. Then when I shaved I felt like there was a snotty layer all over the blades. The blades were still sharp but because of the issue with the protective layer gave me razor burn every time I used it even when using shaving cream. I also felt like my skin was drier than before. I'm trying the product for free thanks to Schick and BuzzAgent and would not buy this razor again.
  232. As a long time user of the Schick Hydro Silk refillable razor, I was interested to see how the disposables from the same line compared. The moisture serum beads along the top and bottom of the razor face are to die for. You could easily shave without your shaving cream/lotion/soap of choice for a quick touch up (which I've totally done); no burn or knicks, glides silky smooth.<br /><br />The rubber handle is fantastic! Just squishy enough to make it easy to hold, even with slippery shower hands. The handle is designed in such a way that the face of the razor doesn't end up in a puddle of water and get rusty/dull/icky, which I really love. This feature also seems to really extend the life of the blades and the moisture serum. Other razors I've used with built-in moisturizers have sometimes had issues with the razor face sitting in water on the shelf in the shower, which turns the built-in moisturizer in to a funky puddle over time - no bueno!<br /><br />So the real question is, why buy these instead of the refillable? The biggest complaint I've had with the refillable version of these razors is this: I wear glasses and have pretty little spatial awareness in the morning without them on. If I bumped my refillable Schick Hydro Silk in to the shower wall or dropped it, the refillable head would pop off. Not a deal breaker, obviously, as I've kept using them! I can't help it; the shave I get with these razors is bar none. But now with these disposables, I get the benefit of a single body piece! As an added bonus, when I travel with these I won't have to worry about losing the body...which might have happened more than once with my refillable!<br /><br />I received a package of the Schick Hydro Silk Disposable Razors as a Bzzagent to try out the product. All opinions are my own :)

This might be worth considering pointing out on the packaging/advertisements. In an age when we are taking more pictures than ever and posting them on social media, the defining shine makes me look better than any other brand has in the past. It's like real life photoshop!<br /><br />The blades were really good. The razor I used to use would give me one or two spots of blood every time I shaved. I nicked myself once in the two months I used the razor.<br /><br />This left me with less razor burn in sensitive areas. Not obsolete, but much less than my old razors.<br /><br />The &#34;Ehh&#34; (there truly was no &#34;bad&#34;):<br /><br />I found that when I kept the razor in a dry place, the gel still gave its intended affect for about three weeks. However, if I put the razor back in its plastic head cover, it would remain moist and a lot of the gel would slide right off the next time I hopped in the shower.<br /><br />The big circle above the razor (where I suppose your thumb is supposed to go) has never made any sense to me, personally. I shave with my pointer fingers on top to guide and my thumb on the bottom of the razor stick for stability. Maybe this is just me!

I'd highly recommend these razors to anyone who wants a great shave for their money! And what makes this even better?   335. I tried the Schick Hydro Silk Disposable razors and at first I hated them. They have a water-activated moisturizing serum that is supposed to hydrate your skin. When I first used them I didn't like them because the moisturizing serum made a goop on my legs that was so gross and hard to wash off. I was using the razor with soap though. I found later that if I used the razor with shaving cream it helped to keep the thick goop down some. I do like how smooth my legs are when I use the razor. I don't know that I would purchase this razor knowing what I do about the moisturizing serum. The longer the razor sat in the shower the moisturizing serum oozed out and left a thick goop hanging out of the razor. You have to be careful how you leave the razor sitting or it will leak out. I also don't know if I would recommend this razor to someone. I liked the way the way the razor felt in my hand and I never cut myself shaving so those were a plus. Like I said, after I started using the razor with shaving cream I noticed a difference in the goopiness of the moisturizing serum. The serum did help to keep my legs soft and smooth. I did receive this product free as a part of a promotional campaign.

The only downside is that the gel strip kind of keeps the razor at a distance that isn't gliding RIGHT on your leg. So the shave is a little further. It's still really good and you probably won't care because the difference is that small, but my cheap disposables leave me with the closest shave ever since there is no fancy gel or anything special about them. Also, I prefer the shape of my cheap disposables because it's tiny and really precise to where I was to shave. But these disposable are more of a legs and underarm razor than a bikini razor.   493. Please DO NOT buy disposable razors if you can help it. There is absolutely no reason to use a disposable razor - the non-disposable sort are much better quality, last much longer, are much more cost effective, AND produce far less unnecessary garbage that is chocking the natural world.<br /><br />Disposable items are a ploy of merchants who want you to keep buying poor quality items at a lower cost, making you think you are getting a deal but you are not. You will end up paying more over time. And in the process, you will create garbage that ends in landfills, sitting there without degrading for hundreds of years, destroying natural habitats that wild animals need. If you want to live in a world devoid of nature, with poisoned air, soil, and water and filled with mountains of trash, go ahead and buy disposable.<br /><br />I have used one Gillette Embrace razor for two years ($9 or so), and have purchased about 3 replacement cartridges since. It still looks and works like new and provides a very fast, perfect shave. Why would you want disposable?

  579. I would give this razor 4.5 stars if I could. I'm impressed on many levels on the performance of this disposable razor. It is a very close shave as well, meaning it only took one pass to get all the hair. Handling - comfortable to hold and maneuver. The head moves with your curves. The handle has the look and feel of my normal razor; not the cheap plastic stick you find with most disposables. Razor Burn/Dryness - after several uses with one razor I have not experienced any razor burn. I contribute this to using a good shave gel along with the moisturizing serum. I did have a little dryness above my ankles after one of my shaves, but I typically use a lotion immediately afterwards and that time I didn't. Overall this razor meets my needs and lasts longer than just a few shaves. It even works well at &#34;delumberjacking&#34; after those winter months! Ladies you know what I'm talking about :) I was able to try this product free thanks to Schick, however, this did not sway my review.

  604. The Schick Hydro Disposable razors are extremely similar to the non disposable version. They have the same serum around the blade of the razor. Because of that it can feel a little goopey and make it a little hard to tell how close the shave is until you rinse it off. But it is a close shave without a lot of razor burn. When shaving my legs there was no razor burn but there was some under my arms. I tend to have very sensitive skin so this wasn't a surprise for me, but it was less that most razors. The handle is the same shape as the non disposable version. It has a nice grip and does not easily slip out of your hands when wet. The handle might be a little less stiff than the regular version but not noticeable unless you are really pressing down on it. The head of the razor basically identical to the non disposable version. The only difference I noticed was that it was a little stiffer. The head seems to not move as freely as non disposable. The one thing the disposable has that the regular version doesn't is a cap that covers the razor when not in use, while the non disposable has a suction cup for the wall instead. Overall the razor provides a good shave with minimal razor burn issues. I tend to fall on the extremely sensitive skin side of the scale and this razor did not give me any issues. Compared to the non disposable the shave is identical, so if you like those razors you will still like these. So if you have sensitive skin and are looking for a disposable option this is one I would recommend trying out. I received this product as part of a promotional campaign.

I don't usually open my sampling packages right away. Sometimes it takes me a day or two. But this one, I wanted to try right away. I've been using the Schick Hydro Silk Disposable Razors for the past two weeks and I've liked it so far. First of all, it is bigger than the average disposable razor. I'd say about 50-75% bigger. The handle is also curved and raised and is comfortable to hold. It feels more like a non-disposable razor than a disposable one, if that makes sense. There are 5 blade. I used to think that three blades were plenty, until I experienced 4 and then 5 blades. I'm not really sure why having multiple blades makes for a more comfortable shave, but it does. I've been using this razor with moisturizing shaving cream and I always apply lotion immediately after. The Schick Hydro Silk razor gives me a close shave, yet it does not hurt or nick my skin.   686. I was able to try this razor complimentary from Bzzagent. I was so excited to be able to try a new razor. I am always on the look out that will beat any current razor that I am using. Schick Hydro Silk Razors is a pack of razors containing three razors. The shaving unit of each razor has 5 blade, running in parallel to each other. I was so excited to see that it had 5 blades. Unfortunately, I didn't see or feel much difference from my 3 blade razor. Moreover, the handle has a broad ovoid base, resembling the business end of a spoon, thereby ensuring an easy grip by even the most butterfingered of users. The handle actually includes a second ovoid region, located at the mid-point of the handle, and this second ovoid region contains a little hole. The little hole further ensures an excellent grip. The entire handle is covered with an elevated layer of rigid silicone rubber, further ensuring a firm grasp, even under the soapiest conditions. I must say, the handle was probably the best part of the razor. Thirdly, the shaving unit also has little pores that release a hydro gel. Above the five blades, and parallel to these blades, is a row of 15 pores, which resemble white dots. Also, below the five blades is another row of 15 pores. The package label reveals that moisturizing serum comes out of the white dots. Regarding the hydro gel released from the pores, because of the 30 pores in all, the amount of hydro gel was somewhat surprising. I have no idea if the &#34;moisturizing serum&#34; or hydro gel is intended to overcome any particular problem with shaving, or if it is intended for use with any particular skin. At any rate, it seems to enhance the shaving experience to a small extent. When I used this razor to shave my legs, along with the included shaving gel, my legs felt surprisingly really smooth. Wasn't sure if it was due to the shaving gel though since I usually use soap. My legs did feel a little irritated and burned. I then used the razor to shave my armpits. Unfortunately, this razor doesn't seem to work as well with hair that is more coarse. My leg hair is pretty thin, but my armpit hair is more thick. It shaved it, but didn't get as close of a shave as my previous razor and it also left spots of blood. The gel was a little too much too so I had to keep rinsing it off constantly. Eventually, I had to go back to my old razor. Basically, using this razor for anything besides your legs or arms is a no go. It doesn't get a really close shave with coarse hair and always leaves your skin slightly irritated. However, I did like the shape of the razor handle as it was nice and easy to grasp during shaving. It is also shaped to keep the blades from touching any flat surface where you might lay down the razor which is nice. In conclusion, I will not be buying these razors in the future. If you have thin hair, then this razor will be great for you. Otherwise, the biggest downfall was not getting as close of a shave as other razors.

The cut is so close to the skin, that I could actually see it scraping off the uppermost part (yielding a color change), leaving my skin looking dry and feeling a bit tender (an hour later my leg is still burning).<br /><br />Why?<br /><br />Schick Hydro Silk's \\"moisturizing serum\\" isn't the best. After running water over the razor, I could feel a slight sliminess coming off of the lines of white dots (located both above and below the blades). Unfortunately, this wasn't thick enough for good protection and it quickly ran out after only a few strokes.<br /><br />However, when I merely rub my hand across a wet bar of soap and wipe it across my skin before shaving with this razor, I don't experience any of the dryness or sensitivity.<br /><br />Recommendation:<br /><br />As good as the cut is, the \\"hydrating\\" aspect didn't work for me, so I can't justify the added expense. However, if you're looking for a super-close shave with a higher-end disposable razor, I recommend it when used with soap/gel.

I have stubborn under-arm hair that takes forever to shave off, I usually have to go over the same spot about 4 times to completely remove the hair, but this razor shaves off everything with just one swipe! I really was impressed by that, that was all thanks to the five razor blades that this disposable razor has. I highly reccomend these! That helps it to dry out quicker and doesn't dull the blades. There are five blades in each razor as opposed to the three in the previous brand I mentioned. I really don't see any kind of difference in how close the shave is. I do however really like that the blade head is flexible which makes it easier for it to glide over my ankles and knees (where I sometimes tend to cut myself). All in all these are nice razors that I would buy again!

I can actually use the normal brands of shaving cream with this razor. I recommend that you store the razor with the blades facing up so that the moisturizing strip isn't touching the shower. When I place it blades down, there is always some residue left from where it was sitting even with the cap on. Still, that's a minor issue for such a great result!

  722. I received a sample of these razors to try from Shick through BzzAgent.<br /><br />On the plus side, I absolutely love the handle of these razors- the shape and size are perfect for a secure, comfortable grip, even when your hands are wet and you've got soap or shaving cream all over. The handle is by far the best one I've ever seen on a disposable razor, and I didn't knick myself once while shaving. I also really like the &#34;serum beads&#34;- I'm not sure that they have much moisturizing effect post-shower (and I immediately use a heavier lotion anyway) but I did feel like they made the razor glide more easily. It was a very smooth, quick shave with no cuts or irritation.<br /><br />The downside- I just don't think it shaves very closely! My legs and underarms felt great when I was done shaving, but one day later they had detectable stubble- and generally I'm someone who can go 2-3 days between shaves even when I'm using cheap razors. I think the number of blades on this razor might have compromised the angle at which they can set them in the head, and the shave just isn't that close. This probably contributes to the lack of irritation or cuts, which is great, but at this price I can't afford to be shaving daily. It's great not to have any razor burn, but not so great to wake up to stubble 24 hours later.<br /><br />This razor has the potential to be amazing- they have a great handle and the serum strips are great. But the actual blades need some tweaking. I'll keep trying new Hydrosilk products as they come out, because they have some good concepts, but I wish they'd stop the more-blades arms race and start making the existing products better. More blades does not always equal a better shave.

  780. I was given some Schick Hydro Silk Disposable razors from the company to try for free as a BzzAgent. I generally just use conditioner or shampoo when I shave my legs, but gave it a shot. I didn't notice a whole lot of difference in the results between the gel and using shampoo or conditioner, but maybe I didn't use enough gel. I did get less nicks, especially around my ankles and knees, than I have sometimes with other razors. I wasn't a huge fan of the water activated serum around the blades, though. While it did help lubricate the razors so they seemed to glide better, it seemed like it also sort of got stuck in the blades making it harder to shave longer hairs. Also, when left without the small plastic cover on, the serum got stuck to the shower wall and peeled off. The shave was quite close, though, and I liked that. Often, in the past, I have been left with bumps and had to go over an area several times for ultimate smoothness. The razor would catch the hair more than cut it, and I could feel as it went over the hairs. With this one, it was such a smooth shave and left my skin so smooth that I actually had to double check to make sure it worked. I have definitely been happy with how it's helped to smooth out my underarms. I think I would prefer that the serum was more solid and harder for it to come off of the razor, but as I said, all things considered, I was definitely happy with the ultimate outcome of the shave.

  835. received this product for free to review thru bzzagent. I absolutely love this product. I consider myself very hairy ( I have to shave every three days). I also have had the same reoccurring problems with every razor that I have used in the past weather they have 3,5, or even six blades. The first problem that I have is that I have to shave over an area repeatedly to get a close shave. The second problem is that I always have hair left on my hard to reach areas which is the sides of my knees, my ankles, and also the back of my thighs. I usually end up with nicks on those areas because its very hard to get the razor the grab those hairs effectively. My third problem is that shaving dries my already dry skin even more. So I end up having to put cocoa butter on top of whatever lotion I put on to keep my legs moisturized. Schick Hydro Silk nails all of these problems for me. I no longer have to step out of the shower after shaving to examine my legs and see what areas were not reached. I also don't have to shave over the same area as often. The most exciting part is that I don't have to worry about ruining my outfits if I shaved right before I go out. You'd be amazed at how much petroleum jelly and cocoa butter can transfer on clothes. I still put lotion on, and my legs are less dried out from the shaving. Another added bonus that I found from this product is that its great for shaving hair on your upper lip, it really contours to grab everything well.
